titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky vs. James C. Brookover, Indictment
CWG9033

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, James F. Robinson: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons, Remissions, and Respites, 1862-1863

body.p:
Mason Circuit Court
The Commonwealth of Kentucky.
Against } Indictment
James C. Brookover.

The Grand Jury of Mason County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky, accuse James C, Brookover of the offense of selling spirituous liquor to slaves, committed as follows: The said James C, Brookover on the 15th day of July 1861 at the County aforesaid, did sell Spirituous liquor to certain slaves, whose names are unknown to the Grand Jury, belonging to the persons whose names are unknown to the Grand Jury, he at the time not having the rightful care and custody of said slaves, or either of them, and not have the written order of the owner, or owners of said slaves, or either of them, or of the person or persons entitled to the custody and care of said slaves to furnish them, or either of them with said liquors, against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

R. H. Stanton
Attorney for the Commonwealth.
(Endorsed as follows towit:)
"A True Bill --
L. B. Gaggin Foreman --
A Copy. Attest. Jno M Duke Jr Clerk
Mason Ct Ct.

Comlth of Ky --
vs. } Copy of Indictment.
James C. Brookover.
